body_html:
Possible the instructions on which basel version to install should be part of the instruction?

https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_sources just says

If bazel is not installed on your system, install it now by following these directions.

I think it can be motivated by the fact that there are multiple versions of basel that can be installed but TensorFlow will not build with all versions.
body_text:
Possible the instructions on which basel version to install should be part of the instruction?
https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_sources just says

If bazel is not installed on your system, install it now by following these directions.

I think it can be motivated by the fact that there are multiple versions of basel that can be installed but TensorFlow will not build with all versions.
body:
Possible the instructions on *which* basel version to install should be part of the instruction?

https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_sources just says

> If bazel is not installed on your system, install it now by following [these directions](https://bazel.build/versions/master/docs/install.html).

I think it can be motivated by the fact that there are multiple versions of basel that can be installed but TensorFlow will not build with all versions.
